title: Network-Based Learning Process Design in Complex Learning Communities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sociological theories and experience in utilizing online communities
context.additional_context: Students collaborate with peers from diverse academic backgrounds, utilizing personal devices to engage in blended online/offline learning activities. Each learner belongs to at least two learning communities, performing cross-community activities.

learning_goals: Learners can explain strategies for building social capital through knowledge exchange across three or more learning communities.
Learners can visualize their learning community connection map and identify key stakeholders using network analysis tools.
Learners can analyze inter-community conflict cases and propose collaborative protocols to resolve them.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
